results.title: A Record of pre-school play
results.creator_credit: Australian Council for Educational Research and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.brief_description: These children are representative of 100 who commenced primary school in Carlton during 1951. Some children had attended the Lady Gowrie Pre-School Centre, some came from other kindergartens and creches and some had not attended any pre-school centre. The children were assembled for two weeks at the end of 1950 to study their vocabulary and this film was made of their unrehearsed and undirected activities. Photography by Rodney Power.

results.title: This is Victoria: Australia
results.brief_description: Silent footage of parts of Victoria and its people from the 1950s produced to promote Victoria. “The Rip” is the first sequence lasting approximately three minutes, where a family park the car to take in the view. They watch large cargo ships traverse the narrow entrance to Port Phillip Bay known as The Rip. Point Lonsdale is shown - the main street (full of fabulous cars from the era) and the lighthouse. Family beach fun is shown as children play in the shallows, people sunbake or rest in the shade of an umbrella, knit, go camping, wash baby in a big plastic tub, walk over the dunes, go surfing or play ballgames. “The Rose Chapel of St Helena” is a sequence approximately two minutes long about a small church in the Eltham/Greensborough area but before getting to that area there are a couple of shots of the City of Melbourne. The Chapel is shown, as are the gravestones from the 1850s that surround the chapel of this small Church of England. Some patrons and a clergyman are also in attendance. “Yarra Bridges” is the final sequence lasting about three minutes and it has some wonderful views of Melbourne and the Bridges that cross the Yarra River. St Pauls Cathedral over Princes Bridge, a view of the Governor’s Residence, cars, trains and assorted automobiles, a white helmeted policeman directing traffic, construction of pillars for a new bridge, the swing bridge at Yarra Bend and a Yarra River Boat Cruise are all shown.

results.title: Shelter
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Wallhead and Vagabond Motion Picture Film Production Unit
results.brief_description:
A disturbed young man, frightened by the threat of nuclear war, wanders the streets in search of safety.

The film was shot on the city streets of Perth, Western Australia.

results.title: They found a cave
results.creator_credit: Andrew Steane, Charles E. Wolnizer and Australian Council for Children's Film and Television
results.brief_description: They found a cave: Four English orphans migrate to Tasmania under the care of their Aunt. Their Aunt becomes sick and is hospitalised, leaving the children to seek refuge in a secret cave. Excitement follows the children as they face danger and adventure in the rugged terrain before they are finally reunited with their Aunt. Based on the novel by Nan Chauncy.

results.title: An Australian Summer
results.brief_description: A gentle comedy exploring, on a humorous and compassionate level, the shifting relationships within an Australian family over two decades, 1960-1980. The complexities of a family relationship where love as a binding force is tested by disappointment, are evocatively portrayed with a deft mixture of humour and poignancy.

results.title: Whereas the people
results.brief_description: Traces the development of the Australian Constitution and investigates its relevance for today as well as examining the politics behind its drafting. The continuous “battle” between State and Federal powers is illustrated by the Franklin Dam case and the process of Constitutional change through referendum is explained.

results.title: Big painter
results.brief_description: A chronological study of the production of a mural by John Firth-Smith begun in 1978 and completed in 1981. The huge painting measures 6m x 48m and hangs in the headquarters of the ANZ Bank, Melbourne.

results.title: Leave it to the chimneys
results.creator_credit: Anti Cancer Council and Crawford Productions
results.brief_description: Seeks to educate the viewer about the hazards of cigarette smoking. Animation and medical photography reveal what smoking can do to the lungs. Directed towards young teenagers who may be making up their minds about whether they should smoke or not. No other credits available.
results.description: Seeks to educate the viewer about the hazards of cigarette smoking. Animation and medical photography reveal what smoking can do to the lungs. Directed towards young teenagers who may be making up their minds about whether they should smoke or not. No other credits available.

results.title: This little pig went to market
results.creator_credit: Ron Saunders, Luci Clark, South Australian Film Corporation and Newfilms
results.brief_description: Carcass classification has taken much of the guesswork out of pig marketing. As a more objective measure in assessing the quality of the pork, classification is better for both producer and consumer. Explains the benefits to the farmer, and the way modern computers program and store production details. Cast includes Brian Moore, Flo Watson, Peter Brechin, Darcy Button, Keith Arnfield.

results.title: Run nickel run: the making of a movie
results.creator_credit: Syd Donovan and TVW Channel Seven
results.brief_description: Documents the making of the feature film “Nickel Queen”. This Australian production directed by John McCallum and starring Googie Withers told the story of the widowed owner of the Mirribilli pub’s sudden turn of fortune during the mining boom in Western Australia. Includes a scene with John Laws as a hippie.
